originalTitle: Ex-Nigerian minister in bribery trial went on spending sprees, court hears
title: A Story About Rules and Sharing Fairly
content:
Hello, Super Kids of Africa! It’s your friendly news reporter here, ready to share an important story with you. Sometimes, grown-ups forget to play by the rules, just like in a game. Today, we're talking about a special kind of grown-up in Nigeria and why it's super important for everyone to be honest and fair.

Meet a Very Important Person

Once upon a time, there was a grown-up lady named Diezani. She used to be a very important person in Nigeria. She was like a super helper for our country, a 'minister'. Her job was to help make big decisions about things like oil, which is a very important resource for Nigeria. When she was a minister, she had a big responsibility to do good things for all the people in our country. Did you know? Nigeria is the biggest country in Africa when we count how many people live there! It has many different languages and cultures, all living together.

What Happened with the Rules?

Now, sometimes, when a country needs something big done, like building new schools or fixing roads, they ask companies to help. This is called a 'contract'. It's like when your mom asks a builder to help fix your house. These contracts are very important because they help our communities grow and stay strong. But here’s where the story gets a little tricky. Some people are saying that Diezani didn't always play by the rules when it came to these contracts. They say that some grown-ups who wanted to get these jobs for their companies gave her special, expensive gifts and lots of money. This made her live a very fancy and rich life in a country called the United Kingdom. Did you know? The United Kingdom is an island country very far away from Nigeria, across the big ocean!

What is a 'Bribe'?

When someone gives a special gift or money to a grown-up in power, hoping that grown-up will do something unfair for them, it's called a 'bribe'. Imagine if your friend gave you an extra tasty snack just so you would let them jump to the front of the line for the swing. That wouldn't be fair to everyone else, right? It's the same with grown-ups. A bribe makes things unfair. When a minister takes a bribe, it means they might not choose the best company for the job. They might choose the company that gave them gifts, even if another company could do the job better or for less money. This is not fair to the country and all the people living in it.

Why is this Not Good for Nigeria?

When money that should be used to build great schools, improve hospitals, or make sure everyone has clean water goes into fancy gifts or a very rich life for one person, it hurts everyone else. That money is supposed to help all of us! It’s like if your class had money for new storybooks, but someone used it all to buy just one very expensive toy for themselves. You wouldn't get your new books! This is why it's so important for people in charge to be honest and fair. They are like the captains of our big team (our country!), and captains must always think about the whole team first. Did you know? Being honest means telling the truth and doing what is right, even when no one is watching. It's a very important superpower!

What Happens Now? A Trip to Court

When grown-ups think someone has broken important rules, they go to a special place called a 'court'. A court is like a big classroom where a special referee, called a 'judge', listens to everyone. They try to find out what really happened and if the rules were broken. Diezani is now going to court in the United Kingdom. This is called a 'trial'. In a trial, people talk about all the things that happened. They show evidence, like clues, to help the judge understand the story. The judge will listen very carefully to decide if Diezani broke the rules by taking bribes. Did you know? Judges often wear special black robes to show they are serious about their job and fair to everyone!

Why Rules Are So Important

Rules help us live together peacefully and fairly. Whether it's the rules in your classroom, the rules for playing a game, or the big rules for a whole country, they are there to make sure everyone has a chance and is treated well. When everyone follows the rules, we can trust each other. We know that the money for schools will go to schools, and the money for hospitals will go to hospitals. That’s how we build a stronger, happier Nigeria for all of you!

Let's Learn from This Story

So, this story reminds us that being fair, honest, and playing by the rules is super important for everyone, especially for grown-ups who have big jobs helping our country. We all want a Nigeria where everyone helps each other and works together to make things better. And remember, you can start being a super honest and fair person today, in your games and with your friends! Keep shining, Super Kids!
summary: A former Nigerian minister, Diezani, is accused of taking special gifts and money, called bribes, from companies who wanted to work with the government, which is not fair to Nigeria.
whyMatters: This story is important because it teaches us that everyone, especially important grown-ups, must always follow the rules and be honest so that money and resources can be used to help everyone in our country, like building schools and hospitals, instead of being spent on unfair, fancy gifts.

originalTitle: The model who moved to Ghana and wrapped her prosthetic leg in its famous fabric
title: Abena's Amazing Adventure: A Star Helping Everyone in Ghana!
content:
Hello, super kids! Get ready for a wonderful story. We have a very special friend to tell you about today. Her name is Abena Christine Jon'el. Abena is a very kind and brave lady. She used to live far away in America. But guess what? She moved to a beautiful country called Ghana! Ghana is a sunny place in Africa. It has amazing people and bright colours. Abena is also a model. That means she takes beautiful pictures for magazines. She has a special leg, and it's wrapped in amazing Ghanaian fabric! Her story is all about kindness, bravery, and making sure everyone feels important.

Meet Abena! A Model with a Mission

Abena is not just any model. She is a model with a big heart. She loves to make people feel happy and seen. Abena was born with a special leg. This special leg helps her walk and run and do all the things she loves. This leg is called a prosthetic leg. It's like a helper leg! She decided to make her special leg even more special and beautiful. She wrapped it in bright, colourful Kente cloth. Kente cloth is a very famous and beautiful fabric from Ghana. It has bright colours and amazing patterns. It looks so beautiful and shows her love for Ghana! Did you know? Kente cloth was once worn only by kings and queens in Ghana! Now, everyone can enjoy its beauty and bright colours.

From America to Sunny Ghana

Abena left her home in America. She travelled across the big, big ocean to get to Africa. She wanted to live in Ghana, which is her family's home country. Ghana is a warm and friendly place. The sun shines brightly almost every day in Ghana. People in Ghana love to smile, sing, and dance. They have wonderful, tasty food too! Abena loves being in Ghana. She feels happy and truly at home there. She loves the sounds, the smells, and the friendly faces of the people. It's a joyful place to be! Ghana is a country full of life and happy energy. Did you know? Ghana is famous for its delicious cocoa beans! Cocoa is used to make yummy chocolate. Yum, yum!

Her Special Leg and Big Heart

Let's talk a little more about Abena's special leg. It helps her move around easily. It helps her do all the things she loves, like walking, standing, and modelling. Abena chose to make her special leg a celebration of Ghana. She covered it with bright, colourful Ghanaian fabric. This makes her leg look like a piece of art! It shows how proud she is of who she is and where she comes from. It also shows her deep love for Ghana and its culture. But Abena wants to do more than just look beautiful in pictures. She has a very important mission in Ghana. She wants to help other people who also have special bodies or who might be a little different. Did you know? A prosthetic leg is made by clever people called prosthetists. They make sure it fits just right so people can move comfortably!

Making Everyone Feel Important

Abena's big dream is to make everyone feel important. Especially people who have disabilities. What does "disability" mean? It means a part of someone's body might work a little differently. Maybe they use a wheelchair to move around. Or maybe they can't see or hear very well. Some people might walk differently. But having a disability does not mean someone is not smart or kind or fun! Everyone is special in their own way. Abena wants everyone to see how amazing these people are. She wants to "raise their profile." This means making more people notice them and their talents. She wants people to understand that everyone is special and unique. She teaches us that we should always treat everyone with kindness and respect. It doesn't matter if someone looks or moves differently from you. We are all people with feelings and dreams. Did you know? Many amazing athletes with disabilities compete in special sports called the Paralympics! They are super strong and fast, just like Olympic athletes!

Why This is Super Important for Ghana

When Abena helps people with disabilities, it helps all of Ghana to become a better place. It teaches us to be kind and understanding to everyone around us. It shows that everyone can contribute and be a part of our community. Imagine if someone can't go to school or play games because of their leg. Abena wants to help change that. She wants schools and other places to be easy for everyone to use, no matter how they move. She wants children with disabilities to know they can achieve their biggest dreams. Abena is showing everyone that being different is okay. In fact, being different can even be beautiful and powerful! It makes the world more interesting. Did you know? When we help others and are kind, it makes us feel happy too! It's like a warm hug for our heart.

Abena's Message for You!

Abena wants all children to remember something very important. Always be kind to everyone you meet. Treat everyone with love and respect. It does not matter how someone looks or how their body works. Every single person has a wonderful heart and special talents. Look for the good and the special things in every person. Abena is like a superhero showing us how to be brave and kind. She uses her voice and her beautiful special leg to help others. What a wonderful way to make the world a better, happier place! Did you know? Africa has many different languages, but kindness is a language that is understood and loved everywhere in the world!
summary: Abena Christine Jon'el, a kind model with a special leg wrapped in beautiful Ghanaian fabric, moved from America to Ghana to help everyone see and respect people with disabilities.
whyMatters: This story matters because Abena is teaching everyone in Ghana, especially kids, that all people are special and important, no matter how their bodies work, helping to build a kinder world for everyone.
